page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The area is dominated by the southern chalk scarp of the Marlborough Downs, which overlooks the Vale of Pewsey. This ridge acts as a watershed between the Rivers Kennet to the North and Avon to the South. The higher points of the scarp are wrinkled with embankments and earthworks of iron-age settlements and afford fine views to the South. The whole area is intensively farmed, though there are substantial numbers of hedgerow-trees and copses below the scarp. There are only two settlements in the area; the small village of Oare (Pop.230) and the hamlet of Huish (Pop. 36). The remaining sparse population is in scattered farm settlements.
